definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: The cards were marked,so I got cleaned.
Bart really cleaned up in the card game.
sentences.chinese: 巴特在紙牌有戲中大獲全勝。

sentences.english: And he traveled by train. And so to pass the time, he would play solitaire.
sentences.chinese: 他坐火車旅行，爲了打發時間，他會玩紙牌。

sentences.english: She fanned out the cards in her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她將紙牌在手中展成扇形。

sentences.english: A deck of cards has thirteen cards with hearts on them .
sentences.chinese: 一付紙牌中十三張上面有紅桃。

sentences.english: The reign of "House Of Cards" may be short-lived.
When the cards have been folded into one pile, the volunteer spreads them out on the table.
sentences.chinese: 當紙牌摺疊成一撂時，志願者將其攤開在桌子上。

sentences.english: With a wicked pack of cards.
sentences.chinese: 她有一副鬼精靈的紙牌。

sentences.english: ’ I’d rush off from a game of cards or a wrestling match for my assignment.
sentences.chinese: 我立刻從紙牌遊戲或者小憩中回過神來接受任務。

sentences.english: The new device is a silicon wafer about the shape and size of a playing card.
sentences.chinese: 這個新設備是一張紙牌大小的硅晶片。

sentences.english: Then , we flew kites and played cards, went for a walk and climbed mountains.
sentences.chinese: 我們放風箏，還玩了紙牌，爬了山又散了步。

sentences.english: Then build a deck array to hold all the card values.
sentences.chinese: 然後構建一副牌數組來保存所有紙牌值。

sentences.english: Golf - solitaire easy to understand, hard to solve.
On his board is a message intended to evoke a warm response in passers-by who will, with any luck, throw him some coins.
sentences.chinese: 紙牌上寫的字旨在喚起路人的同情心，給他一點零錢。

definition: to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke
